content.description:
This route climbs the most direct line up the middle of the face, on small positive edges with occasional reachy moves.

 If you either rappel or get lowered in there is a small ledge at the bottom to stand on with enough room for just the climber at most water levels.

 I cleaned this route last year, and the rock is somewhat friable so watch out for holds snapping off.
content.location: As you walk in from the parking lot stay along the cliff top and you'll clearly see the face. If you set up a top rope with the trees there this is the best line up the middle.

content.description: Relatively easy climb. The rock is a little chossy so be careful.
content.protection: There aren't many places to build an anchor at the top, so place a couple cams to make your own top rope anchor.
content.location: There's a little parking spot on the right of the road that leads to the popular swimming spot. Once you get to the swim spot, turn right and the climb will be right under the bridge. The town says you cannot place fixed gear so you have to make your own anchor

content.description:
This is a popular swimming hole and town park in West Lebanon, NH. It's super popular with locals and a fun place to cool off when it's hot. Among the tumbling water and rocks there is a steep section of relatively chossy rock, with a nice face that has a few lines on it. The rock is pretty chossy and friable tho. I cleaned it last year, and besides lichen and bushes a lot of rock came off it too.

 As it is town property please do not bolt this area. The trees are robust enough at the cliff top for top roping.

 Be mindful of others while you're there, if the weather is nice you'll probably see other people. Pack out trash if you can.

 This place isn't worth seeking out, but if you're in the area it's a really fun spot to climb. It's a cool setting no matter the time of year, in the winter the tumbling water ices up (tho not completely) and in the summer the sun shines right down into the heart of the gorge.
